intro: Quapoya sulphurea, commonly known as the sulfur bush, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its yellowish-green foliage and sulfur-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in dense inflorescences. Quapoya sulphurea is valued for its ornamental qualities and has cultural significance in some island communities.
